title.narrative: EVIDENCE-BASED POLICY FOR CHILD POVERTY

description.narrative: By the end of 2015, national authorities use a reliable sex-disaggregated data system for planning, budgeting and monitoring to address child poverty and exclusion., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, more excluded children and families benefit from education, social welfare, and justice services, in line with new legislation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, national authorities use a reliable sex-disaggregated data system for planning, budgeting and monitoring toaddress child poverty and exclusion.
% of new policies relevant to children developed on the basis of evidence as of January 2011
% of children at risk of poverty before social transfers (excluding pensions) vs. % of budget allocated for child allowances
Issuance and use of annual progress reports on implementation of social welfare and education laws

target.value: 2015:4 annual analytical progress reports produced in the field of social welfare and 3 annual analytical progress reports produced on the inclusion provisions of the education law

actual.value: 2015:In the period from 2011 -2015, 7 annual reports are produced in the area of social welfare by the Institute for Social Protection and 3 annual reports in the field of education published by the National Education Council.
